item.title: The 20 photographs of the week
item.trailText: Horror in Tunisia, a derailment in Pakistan and tennis at Wimbledon – the best photography in news, culture and sport from around the world this week
item.standFirst: Horror in Tunisia, a derailment in Pakistan and tennis at Wimbledon – the best photography in news, culture and sport from around the world this week

displayImages.caption: Revellers wait for the sunrise in the Stone Circle area as Glastonbury festival draws to a close Photograph: Oli Scarff/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Revellers wait for the sunrise in the Stone Circle area as Glastonbury festival drew to a close on Sunday 28th June.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Revellers wait for the sunrise in the Stone Circle area as Glastonbury festival draws to a close

displayImages.caption: Free Syrian Army fighters fire from a tank during what they said was an offensive against the forces of Syria’s president Bashar al-Assad in the southern city of Deraa, Syria Photograph: Reuters
displayImages.altText: Free Syrian Army fighters fire from a tank during what they said was an offensive against the forces of Syria’s president Bashar al-Assad in the southern city of Deraa, Syria
displayImages.cleanCaption: Free Syrian Army fighters fire from a tank during what they said was an offensive against the forces of Syria’s president Bashar al-Assad in the southern city of Deraa, Syria

displayImages.caption: A Tunisian policeman patrols the beach in front of the Riu Imperial Marhaba hotel in Sousse following the beach shooting two days earlier Photograph: Kenzo Tribouillard/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: A Tunisian policeman patrols the beach in front of the Riu Imperial Marhaba hotel in Sousse following the beach shooting two days earlier
displayImages.cleanCaption: A Tunisian policeman patrols the beach in front of the Riu Imperial Marhaba hotel in Sousse following the beach shooting two days earlier

displayImages.caption: Women carry baskets filled with firewood collected from the mountains towards their homes in Kashmir, India. Photograph: Yawar Nazir/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Women carry baskets filled with firewood collected from the mountains towards their homes in Kashmir, India.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Women carry baskets filled with firewood collected from the mountains towards their homes in Kashmir, India.

displayImages.caption: People swim during the annual public Lake Zurich crossing swimming event. The participants swam a distance of 1,500m Photograph: Arnd Wiegmann/Reuters
displayImages.altText: People swim during the annual public Lake Zurich crossing swimming event. The participants swam a distance of 1,500m
displayImages.cleanCaption: People swim during the annual public Lake Zurich crossing swimming event. The participants swam a distance of 1,500m

displayImages.caption: Army soldiers hold hands while conducting a search operation after a train fell into a canal near Gujranwala in Pakistan Photograph: REX Shutterstock
displayImages.altText: Army soldiers hold hands while conducting a search operation after a train fell into a canal near Gujranwala in Pakistan
displayImages.cleanCaption: Army soldiers hold hands while conducting a search operation after a train fell into a canal near Gujranwala in Pakistan

displayImages.caption: Palestinian girls wait ahead of prayers on the third Friday of the holy month of Ramadan at the compound known to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary and to Jews as Temple Mount, in Jerusalem’s old city Photograph: Ammar Awad/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Palestinian girls wait ahead of prayers on the third Friday of the holy month of Ramadan at the compound known to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary and to Jews as Temple Mount, in Jerusalem’s old city
displayImages.cleanCaption: Palestinian girls wait ahead of prayers on the third Friday of the holy month of Ramadan at the compound known to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary and to Jews as Temple Mount, in Jerusalem’s old city

displayImages.caption: A traditional Burundian drummer looks on while soldiers march in formation towards the Prince Rwagasore stadium in Bujumbura on the country’s 53rd independence anniversary Photograph: Marco Longari/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: A traditional Burundian drummer looks on while soldiers march in formation towards the Prince Rwagasore stadium in Bujumbura on the country’s 53rd independence anniversary
displayImages.cleanCaption: A traditional Burundian drummer looks on while soldiers march in formation towards the Prince Rwagasore stadium in Bujumbura on the country’s 53rd independence anniversary

displayImages.caption: People dressed in traditional clothing celebrate Kupala night in the village of Rakau, 30km west of Minsk in Belarus. People celebrate the holiday with bonfires that last throughout the night, with some leaping over the flames to cleanse themselves of illness and bad luck. Photograph: Uladz Hyrdzin/AFP/Getty
displayImages.altText: People dressed in traditional clothing celebrate Kupala night in the village of Rakau, 30km west of Minsk in Belarus. People celebrate the holiday with bonfires that last throughout the night, with some leaping over the flames to cleanse themselves of illness and bad luck.
displayImages.cleanCaption: People dressed in traditional clothing celebrate Kupala night in the village of Rakau, 30km west of Minsk in Belarus. People celebrate the holiday with bonfires that last throughout the night, with some leaping over the flames to cleanse themselves of illness and bad luck.

displayImages.caption: A migrant woman and her baby leave a train on the Tabanovce border crossing between Macedonia and Serbia on her way north to Europe Photograph: Dimitar Dilkoff/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: A migrant woman and her baby leave a train on the Tabanovce border crossing between Macedonia and Serbia on her way north to Europe
displayImages.cleanCaption: A migrant woman and her baby leave a train on the Tabanovce border crossing between Macedonia and Serbia on her way north to Europe

displayImages.caption: Team Sky, including Britain’s Chris Froome, train near Utrecht, Netherlands, the day before the start of the three-week-long Tour de France Photograph: Laurent Cipriani/AP
displayImages.altText: Team Sky, including Britain’s Chris Froome, train near Utrecht, Netherlands, the day before the start of the three-week-long Tour de France
displayImages.cleanCaption: Team Sky, including Britain’s Chris Froome, train near Utrecht, Netherlands, the day before the start of the three-week-long Tour de France

displayImages.caption: Security forces and rescue teams examine the wreckage of an Indonesian military C-130 Hercules transport plane after it crashed into a residential area in the north Sumatra city of Medan  Photograph: Roni Bintang/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Security forces and rescue teams examine the wreckage of an Indonesian military C-130 Hercules transport plane after it crashed into a residential area in the north Sumatra city of Medan
displayImages.cleanCaption: Security forces and rescue teams examine the wreckage of an Indonesian military C-130 Hercules transport plane after it crashed into a residential area in the north Sumatra city of Medan

displayImages.caption: People cool down in a fountain beside the Manzanares river in Madrid, Spain. Weather stations are warning people to take extra precautions as a heatwave engulfs much of the country  Photograph: Andres Kudacki/AP
displayImages.altText: People cool down in a fountain beside the Manzanares river in Madrid, Spain. Weather stations are warning people to take extra precautions as a heatwave engulfs much of the country
displayImages.cleanCaption: People cool down in a fountain beside the Manzanares river in Madrid, Spain. Weather stations are warning people to take extra precautions as a heatwave engulfs much of the country

displayImages.caption: A Shia Houthi rebel holds up a fragment of metal next to the rubble of houses destroyed by a Saudi-led airstrike in Sanaa, Yemen Photograph: Hani Mohammed/AP
displayImages.altText: A Shia Houthi rebel holds up a fragment of metal next to the rubble of houses destroyed by a Saudi-led airstrike in Sanaa, Yemen
displayImages.cleanCaption: A Shia Houthi rebel holds up a fragment of metal next to the rubble of houses destroyed by a Saudi-led airstrike in Sanaa, Yemen

displayImages.caption: Serena Williams celebrates her centre court victory over Heather Watson on day five of Wimbledon 2015 at the All England Lawn Tennis Club Photograph: Tom Jenkins for the Observer
displayImages.altText: Serena Williams celebrates her centre court victory over Heather Watson on day five of Wimbledon 2015 at the All England Lawn Tennis Club
displayImages.cleanCaption: Serena Williams celebrates her centre court victory over Heather Watson on day five of Wimbledon 2015 at the All England Lawn Tennis Club
displayImages.cleanCredit: Photograph: Tom Jenkins for the Observer

displayImages.caption: A protester wears a mask with a gag in Madrid, Spain. Thousands of protesters railed against a new public security law nicknamed the ‘gag law’, branding it legalised muzzling of free expression  Photograph: Andres Kudacki/AP
displayImages.altText: A protester wears a mask with a gag in Madrid, Spain. Thousands of protesters railed against a new public security law nicknamed the ‘gag law’, branding it legalised muzzling of free expression
displayImages.cleanCaption: A protester wears a mask with a gag in Madrid, Spain. Thousands of protesters railed against a new public security law nicknamed the ‘gag law’, branding it legalised muzzling of free expression

displayImages.caption: An elderly man sells tissues outside a shuttered shop in central Athens. Photograph: Aris Messinis/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: An elderly man sells tissues outside a shuttered shop in central Athens.
displayImages.cleanCaption: An elderly man sells tissues outside a shuttered shop in central Athens.

displayImages.caption: Riot police use a water cannon to disperse LGBT rights activists before a Gay Pride parade in central Istanbul, Turkey Photograph: Reuters
displayImages.altText: Riot police use a water cannon to disperse LGBT rights activists before a Gay Pride parade in central Istanbul, Turkey
displayImages.cleanCaption: Riot police use a water cannon to disperse LGBT rights activists before a Gay Pride parade in central Istanbul, Turkey

displayImages.caption: A South Korean marine looks up as he and others take part in a landing operation drill  Photograph: KIM HONG-JI/Kim Hong-Ji/Reuters
displayImages.altText: A South Korean marine looks up as he and others take part in a landing operation drill
displayImages.cleanCaption: A South Korean marine looks up as he and others take part in a landing operation drill

displayImages.caption: Horses race during the general practice session for the Palio di Siena horse race in Italy, which has been held every 2 July and 16 August since the mid-1600s. Photograph: Max Rossi/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Horses race during the general practice session for the Palio di Siena horse race in Italy, which has been held every 2 July and 16 August since the mid-1600s.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Horses race during the general practice session for the Palio di Siena horse race in Italy, which has been held every 2 July and 16 August since the mid-1600s.
